intro: Lithraea gilliesii, commonly known as the mountain ash or the gum tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Australia, particularly found in the temperate regions of New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round foliage. Lithraea gilliesii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
